article_title: State-based solutions key to universal health coverage, SIU graduation speaker says
article_text:
Posted May 20, 2016 at 9:33 PM

Updated May 20, 2016 at 9:48 PM

article_metadata.description: The 68 people who will become doctors Saturday after graduating from Southern Illinois University School of Medicine are entering a health-care system with obvious problems, journalist and documentary filmmaker T.R. Reid says.The federal Affordable Care Act has “greatly expanded coverage, but it didn’t get it to where it ought to be,” said Reid, a former Washington Post reporter who will be the keynote speaker Saturday at SIU's 42nd commencement ceremony in Springfield.
article_metadata.author: Dean Olsen

og.description: The 68 people who will become doctors Saturday after graduating from Southern Illinois University School of Medicine are entering a health-care system
